Cyclone Gabrielle: ‘Hero’ chef Neela Neela makes last free meals before break https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/cyclone-gabrielle-hero-chef-neela-neela-makes-last-free-meals-before-break/2SA2WWWDDBGUDBY4ZCA5ZLKAIQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/hawkes-bay-today/news/cyclone-gabrielle-hero-chef-neela-neela-makes-last-free-meals-before-break/2SA2WWWDDBGUDBY4ZCA5ZLKAIQ/ James PocockNeela Neela will take a well-earned holiday, but doesn't plan to stop helping others. Covid-19: Still no sign of ‘Pirola’ surge in NZ, latest monitoring shows https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/covid-19-still-no-sign-of-pirola-surge-in-nz-latest-monitoring-shows/TST2FQIM3ZBRFLKPSHXCHZKTQY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/covid-19-still-no-sign-of-pirola-surge-in-nz-latest-monitoring-shows/TST2FQIM3ZBRFLKPSHXCHZKTQY/ Jamie MortonThere’s still no sign a new mutant coronavirus subvariant is making a splash in NZ. Sun, 08 Oct 2023 03:56:28 +0000 The Omicron off-shoot BA.2.86 - whose 36 mutations set it well apart from its closest relative - has been spreading around the world since it was first discovered in Denmark and Israel in late July.

Project to seal Forgotten World Highway’s Tāngarākau Gorge resumes on October 9 https://www.nzherald.co.nz/whanganui-chronicle/news/project-to-seal-forgotten-world-highways-tangarakau-gorge-resumes-on-october-9/BBIDRYDECFCBJA6HKJ2V2ZV2GI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/whanganui-chronicle/news/project-to-seal-forgotten-world-highways-tangarakau-gorge-resumes-on-october-9/BBIDRYDECFCBJA6HKJ2V2ZV2GI/ Motorists should plan ahead as the road will be closed at times. World first: Scientists to map carbon profile of every NZ city and town https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/world-first-scientists-to-map-carbon-profile-of-every-nz-city-and-town/KTSF2ZXBPJC3JMGHR2NCYANCE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/world-first-scientists-to-map-carbon-profile-of-every-nz-city-and-town/KTSF2ZXBPJC3JMGHR2NCYANCE/ Jamie MortonNZ could be first nation to have real-time emissions data for all urban centres. Sun, 08 Oct 2023 01:34:58 +0000 Cities remain New Zealand’s biggest source of carbon dioxide, but just how much CO2 they send into the atmosphere - or absorb with trees and parks - hasn’t been completely clear. Photo / Dean Purcell
